itemDescription: first female announcer on the BBC’s National Service

wikipedia_page.main: Sheila Borrett (born Margaret Sheila Graham; 20 June 1905 – 30 April 1986) was a British radio presenter, the first female announcer on the BBC’s National Service. At the time of her work as a BBC announcer she was referred to as Mrs Giles Borrett, but she generally used the stage name Sheila Stewart, or during a later marriage Sheila Wasey.
